highlights.representative_text: believed, "My house is a liability, and if your house is your largest investment, you're in trouble."

highlights.representative_text: By asking the question "How can I afford it?" your brain is put to work.
highlights.selected_text: By asking the question "How can I afford it?" your brain is put to work

highlights.representative_text: Money is one form of power. But what is more powerful is financial education.
highlights.selected_text: Money is one form of power. But what is more powerful is financial education

highlights.representative_text: Opportunities come and go. Being able to know when to make quick decisions is an important skill.
highlights.selected_text: Opportunities come and go. Being able to know when to make quick decisions is an important skill

highlights.representative_text: cover himself by saying, "There is a difference between being poor and being broke. - Broke is temporary, and poor is eternal."
highlights.selected_text: There is a difference between being poor and being broke. - Broke is temporary, and poor is eternal

highlights.representative_text: They work very hard, for little money, clinging to the illusion of job security, looking forward to a three-week vacation each year and a skimpy pension after forty-five years of work.
highlights.selected_text: They work very hard, for little money, clinging to the illusion of job security, looking forward to a three-week vacation each year and a skimpy pension after forty-five years of work

highlights.representative_text: "If you learn life's lessons, you will do well. If not, life will just continue to push you around.
highlights.selected_text: If you learn life's lessons, you will do well. If not, life will just continue to push you around

highlights.representative_text: "If you choose to work for money, that is what life is like for many people," said rich dad.
highlights.selected_text: If you choose to work for money, that is what life is like for many people

highlights.representative_text: LESSON #l: The Rich Don't Work For Money
highlights.selected_text: LESSON #l: The Rich Don't Work For Money

highlights.representative_text: Let me tell you, it's easier to change yourself than everyone else."
highlights.selected_text: it's easier to change yourself than everyone else

highlights.representative_text: "The poor and the middle class work for money." "The rich have money work for them."
highlights.selected_text: The poor and the middle class work for money." "The rich have money work for them

highlights.representative_text: But the joy that money brings is often short lived, and they soon need more money for more joy, more pleasure, more comfort, more security.
highlights.selected_text: But the joy that money brings is often short lived, and they soon need more money for more joy, more pleasure, more comfort, more security

highlights.representative_text: "If you want to learn to work for money, then stay in school. That is a great place to learn to do that.
highlights.selected_text: If you want to learn to work for money, then stay in school. That is a great place to learn to do that

highlights.representative_text: "Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions.
highlights.selected_text: Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions

highlights.representative_text: Rich dad went on to explain that a human's life is a struggle between ignorance and illumination.
highlights.selected_text: human's life is a struggle between ignorance and illumination

highlights.representative_text: "Keep working boys, but the sooner you forget about needing a paycheck, the easier your adult life will be.
highlights.selected_text: sooner you forget about needing a paycheck, the easier your adult life will be

highlights.representative_text: "Fear pushes you out the door, and desire calls to you. Enticing you toward the rocks. That's the trap."
highlights.selected_text: Fear pushes you out the door, and desire calls to you. Enticing you toward the rocks. That's the trap

highlights.representative_text: is on the same course, proving once again that history repeats itself, because we do not learn from history. We only memorize historical dates and names, not the lesson.
highlights.selected_text: we do not learn from history. We only memorize historical dates and names, not the lesson.

highlights.representative_text: Most people live their lives chasing paychecks, pay raises and job security because of the emotions of desire and fear, not really questioning where those emotion-driven thoughts are leading them.
highlights.selected_text: Most people live their lives chasing paychecks, pay raises and job security because of the emotions of desire and fear, not really questioning where those emotion-driven thoughts are leading them

highlights.representative_text: Prices go up because of greed and fear caused by ignorance.
highlights.selected_text: Prices go up because of greed and fear caused by ignorance

highlights.representative_text: If people are prepared to be flexible, keep an open mind and learn, they will grow richer and richer through the changes. If they think money will solve problems, I am afraid those people will have a rough ride. Intelligence solves problems and produces money. Money without financial intelligence is money soon gone.
highlights.selected_text: If people are prepared to be flexible, keep an open mind and learn, they will grow richer and richer through the changes. If they think money will solve problems, I am afraid those people will have a rough ride. Intelligence solves problems and produces money. Money without financial intelligence is money soon gone.

highlights.representative_text: "Rich people acquire assets. The poor and middle class acquire liabilities, but they think they are assets"
highlights.selected_text: Rich people acquire assets. The poor and middle class acquire liabilities, but they think they are assets

highlights.representative_text: You must know the difference between an asset and a liability, and buy assets. If you want to be rich, this is all you need to know.
highlights.selected_text: You must know the difference between an asset and a liability, and buy assets. If you want to be rich, this is all you need to know

highlights.representative_text: It is that same fear, the fear of ostracism that causes people to conform and not question commonly accepted opinions or popular trends.
highlights.selected_text: It is that same fear, the fear of ostracism that causes people to conform and not question commonly accepted opinions or popular trends

highlights.representative_text: The fear of being different prevents most people from seeking new ways to solve their problems.
highlights.selected_text: The fear of being different prevents most people from seeking new ways to solve their problems.

highlights.representative_text: The No. 1 expense for most people is taxes.
highlights.selected_text: The No. 1 expense for most people is taxes

highlights.representative_text: And when it comes to money, high emotions tend to lower financial intelligence.
highlights.selected_text: And when it comes to money, high emotions tend to lower financial intelligence.

highlights.representative_text: An asset is something that puts money in my pocket. A liability is something that takes money out of my pocket.
highlights.selected_text: An asset is something that puts money in my pocket. A liability is something that takes money out of my pocket.

highlights.representative_text: Many great financial problems are caused by going along with the crowd and trying to keep up with the Joneses.
highlights.selected_text: Many great financial problems are caused by going along with the crowd and trying to keep up with the Joneses

highlights.representative_text: "An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than they are."
highlights.selected_text: An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than they are

highlights.representative_text: it began to make some sense: Wealth is a person's ability to survive so many number of days forward... or if I stopped working today, how long could I survive?

highlights.representative_text: The problem with simply working harder is that each of these three levels takes a greater share of your increased efforts. You need to learn how to have your increased efforts benefit you and your family directly.
highlights.selected_text: The problem with simply working harder is that each of these three levels takes a greater share of your increased efforts. You need to learn how to have your increased efforts benefit you and your family directly

highlights.representative_text: Once you understand the difference, concentrate your efforts on only buying income-generating assets. That's the best way to get started on a path to becoming rich. Keep doing that, and your asset column will grow. Focus on keeping liabilities and expenses down. This will make more money available to continue pouring into the asset column.
